ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: So much! From how to write abstracts, proposals, to how to present at conferences. Orals lists/exams, dissertating, so much!

This semester, I gained knowledge and skills on how to prepare a fellowship application. I also strengthened my interdisciplinary research skills, by exploring the intersections between Latinx Studies and Native Studies.

This course helped to expand my knowledge in Latinx Studies and better understand how to situate my work within the field. It helped me learn about various scholars relevant to my work. It also helped me better workshop material, both as the one workshopping material and as a participant in workshopping another's work.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths: the instructors do an exemplary job at making sure all those in the class are supported and listened to. This allows for more meaningful and personal discussions. Weaknesses: N/A
Limit the number of students who are workshopping works in each session to 2, so that we can more deeply engage and not feel rushed.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! The working group was crucial to my semester.
Yes, as a course designed to hone your personal skills and also contribute to others' success, this class is necessary and important.
Absolutely! Both for the intellectual rigor as well as the community it offers to us.
Yes. For students in Latinx Studies this is an incredibly helpful and supportive learning environment.
